page.title: 15EDUCATION
page.content: In May 1974,the old school was abandoned due to the increasing number of pupils,and the tendency to flooding of the basement and boiler room.This was because the school was close to the Bevern Brook and a heavy rainstorm always caused flooding.The modern school was built to the north of the old school.Children who live in East Chiltington go to Hamsey or Plumpton, depending on the wish of their parents.The headmaster of Plumpton is Mr A.W.Dannatt,who is retiring this year.The old school is 107 years old.The new school is 11. There are about 96 children in the school nowadays,boys and girls from four and a half to 11.Because of falling numbers,the school is reduced to four classes.When the children leave school at 11,they go to the local secondary at Chailey,the next village.
